channel.title: COMP90007 Tutorial - Yiran Ruan
channel.description: Recent content on COMP90007 Tutorial - Yiran Ruan

item.title: Tutorial_week9
item.description: This is tutorial slides for week9 ​ Sorry for the late update. ​ In this week, we have talked about deadlock, 3-way handshake and 2-army problems. Due to no solution for 2-army problems as for now, both 2-way handshake and 3-way handshake have risk to encouneter deadlock. To solve this problem, we use connection release as a example, to show you how important timer is in our system. Timer would set a time and expected to receive reply during this period.

item.title: Tutorail_week8
item.description: This is tutorial slides for week8 ​ In this week, we have discussed about Aggregation of IP addresses. Then we talked about one method to find correct network that one IP address belongs to. ​ In terms of routing algorithms. There are two categroies. One is non-adaptive algorithm. Routers would calculate the next hop when the network is booted. Another one is adaptive algorithm, which would make desicions depending on information collected from the environment.

item.title: Tutorial_week7
item.description: This is tutorial slides for week7 ​ In this week, we have discussed about MACA protocol, IP address (mainly about prefix and subnetmask) and fragmentation. ​ MACA, which is an wonderful protocol to help us aviod collisions withour carrier sense medium. The basic idea is that for the sender to stimulate the receiver into outputting a short frame, so stations nearby can detect this transmission and avoid transmitting for the duration of the upcoming (large) data frame.

item.title: Tutorial_week6
item.description: This is tutorial slides for week6 ​ In this week, we have discussed about several protocols that we used in Data Link layer and a brief introduction about IP address. ​ The first protocol is stop-and-wait. It is pretty simple. The sender sends one frame and then waits for an acknowledgement before proceeding. ​ Then we talked about CRC, one kind of the checksum that we used in data link layer.

item.title: Tutorial_week5
item.description: This is tutorial slides for week5 ​ Here is the slides. More info would be updated later. Have fun with your project. Cheers, Yiran Ruan

item.title: Tutorial_week4
item.description: This is tutorial slides for week4 ​ The first thing that we discussed in this week is two important theorems, Nyquist’s and Shannon’s theorem, in physical layer. The main difference between them is Nyquist’s theorem assums the channel that we used to transform data is noise-less while the Shannon’s theorem is only used for a noisy channel. They both have two components in their formula, bandwidth and levels of signal.

item.title: Tutorial_week3
item.description: This is tutorial slides for week3 ​ In this week, we have compared the properties between OSI model and TCP/IP model. They both have a similar stacking protocol achitecture, which holds advantages on flexibility and information hiding (content in week2). In terms of differences, OSI model has a good distinguish between Service, Protocol and Interface. In the meanwhile, TCP/IP doesn’t. ​ Service defines what the process does, but not how entities above it access it or how the layer works.

item.title: Tutorial_week2
item.description: This is tutorial for week2 ​ In week 2, we have learned how to use Wireshark and wget to test the network ​ We simply introduced IP address, three-way handshake, overhead and layer achetechture. ​ Hope you have fun with this subject and my tutorial. ​ This is my slides. Cheers, Yiran Ruan

item.title: Important notices about COMP90007 tutorial
item.description: Notices about COMP90007 tutorial Hi students, ​ Welcome to my repository and thank you to come my tutorials. ​ I am glad if you like my tutorials. ​ Here is the tutorial slides for each week. Feel free to download it. And please give me a star if you like it LOL. I will maintain this GitHub repository continually. You could watch it and if you found any problems in my slides, you are welcome to start a new issues here.
